CatDescriptText: Mrs. Betty Kenneth, state office employee, of Oakland, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "I haven't thought about it.  I'm Catholic and we have all nationalities in our church.  I think that mixed memberships should be encouraged."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty Kenneth, wearing light colored herringbone coat with belt and single round button at neckline, light colored head scarf, and light colored hat, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Empire Building, Downtown
